main.title: Mental Health
text: Each person's mental health is unique and can take one of many forms. These descriptions aren't all-encompassing, and if you have any worries about your own mental health, please consult a professional.

sub.title: Depression
text: Depression specifically has several common characteristics: depressed mood, loss of interest or pleasure, changes in weight, physical slowness, fatigue, inability to concentrate, and recurring thoughts of death.

sub.title: Anxiety
text: Anxiety can manifest in different ways, too: excessive worry, restlessness, fatigue, inability to concentrate, irritability, muscle pains, and difficulty sleeping.

sub.title: Inventories
text: Below are two self-reported inventories of depression and anxiety; they can be a starting point, but they should never replace professional support

sub.title: Hotlines
text: At the bottom are contact links for immediate help. If you are suffering, please know that there will always be people to support you.
